text: just about 40% of the world uses the
Internet and among those users most
unsurprisingly live in developed
countries but the rest of the world is
rapidly embracing technology too that's
what the Pew Research Center found in a
survey of 24 emerging nations so how do
we get here across the surveyed
countries only 2 in 10 people said they
have a landline at home you see they've
skipped landlines and gone straight to
using mobile technology Kenya is a good
case study landlines just aren't a
factor only 1% of people surveyed have
one at home but almost seven in 10 used
mobile phones for financial transactions
it's a mobile payment bonanza but it's
also mostly a regional thing outside of
Africa only a median of about one in ten
people surveyed use their phones for
payments but what most countries do have
in common is embracing social networking
once people get online except for China
half of Internet users there don't log
on to social sites overall more people
may be online but they're not all doing
it on the move smartphones are pretty
much a luxury
Lebanon has the highest use of nation
survey
Pakistan has the lowest Tech's biggest
impact on emerging countries may be the
flow of information and ideas take
Venezuela for example three out of four
people said that social networking had
revealed something new about a contacts
political belief David Botti BBC News
Washington
